"Basket" Formation New Ground Photos© 1999 by Linda Moulton Howe"Basket" wheat formation discovered in the early morning of August 6, 1999at Bishops Cannings before the farmer erased it entirely with his tractor. 46.3 meters(152 feet) diameter. Aerial photograph © 1999 by Ulrich Kox. September 19, 1999 Bishops Cannings, Wiltshire, England AndreasMueller, a student from Saarbruecken, Germany, and his colleague fromSwitzerland, Werner Anderhub, took the only ground photographs of theremarkable "Basket" formation before the farmer destroyed it with his harvesteron August 6th at Bishop Cannings near Devizes and Roundway Hill . SeeEarthfiles August 15, 1999 for further information.Fortunately, not only were aerial and ground photographs taken before thewheat was cut down, but Andreas Mueller was able to make sketches andmeasurements. Below are ground photographs and Mueller's diagram of the cropformation's complicated lay.
Photos © 1999 by Werner Anderhub, Bern Switzerland.

Survey © 1999 by Andreas Mueller.
